meanings.definition: Relating to the study of books as physical objects.
meanings.sent1: The bibliographically valuable book had intricate illustrations.
meanings.sent2: She admired the bibliographically interesting cover of the old book.
meanings.sent3: The bibliographically curious cat knocked over a stack of books.
meanings.sent4: His room was a bibliographically organized paradise of rare books.
meanings.sent5: The bibliographically detailed descriptions made the book come alive.

meanings.definition: In a manner that pertains to the organization and description of written or printed works.
meanings.sent1: She organized the books bibliographically on the shelf.
meanings.sent2: The librarian cataloged the books bibliographically for easy access.
meanings.sent3: The author humorously described the characters bibliographically.
meanings.sent4: Her mind worked bibliographically, arranging thoughts like chapters.
meanings.sent5: The artist painted the scene bibliographically, capturing every detail.

meanings.definition: In a way that involves the compilation and analysis of bibliographic information.
meanings.sent1: He researched bibliographically to create a comprehensive bibliography.
meanings.sent2: The student cited all sources bibliographically in the research paper.
meanings.sent3: The detective solved the case by thinking bibliographically.
meanings.sent4: Her approach to the project was bibliographically thorough and precise.
meanings.sent5: The historian examined the documents bibliographically to uncover hidden truths.
